data.event: European settlement began in 1863 when the first settlers arrived, mostly German immigrants.
A town reserve was established in 1865 on the souther bank near the junction of the Logan and Albert Rivers.

event.title: 1869, the first Lutheran church was established

data.event: In 1869, the first Lutheran church was established near the Lutheran cemetery on Zipfs Road.

event.title: 1870, a ferry service across the river was introduced

data.event: In 1870, a ferry service across the river was introduced with the first bridge being built in 1876 at Yatala.
The Alberton Provisional School opened on 13 May 1876 with children attending German school on only one day a week.
On 13 October 1884 the provisional school became the Alberton State School.

event.title: 1886, a new larger Lutheran church (the present St Peter's at 187 Alberton Road) was built

data.event: In 1886, a new larger Lutheran church (the present St Peter's at 187 Alberton Road) was built.
It was consecrated in 1887 by Rev Hellmuth.
